version_description:
This update includes the following improvements:

In FIPS mode, the minimum key size for server certificates accepted by the client will be 2048 bits. SHA-1 can no longer be used for digital signatures. Only SHA256 or greater is now supported in FIP

Resolves CSCuo17488 – AnyConnect for iOS is vulnerable to CVE-2014-0160 – Heartbleed

Disconnect AnyConnect connection before upgrading
Please make sure your AnyConnect VPN is disconnected when you upgrade. Otherwise, you may fail to connect a

An issue outside of our control caused the 6/19/14 update to not function properly. Now that this has been resolved, the same software had to be resubmitted with a new version number. We are very sorry for the inconvenience caused by this issue.

3.

We recommend iOS 8.1 and not iOS 8.0.x due to a VPN disconnect issue present in iOS 8.0.x.
After upgrading a device to iOS 8, you must open AnyConnect directly before making a VPN connection.
